did.abstract: Collection comprises two letters by William Henry Burr. Topics in the 1883 letter include a scam involving "that fellow 'Kellogg'" and rumored presidential scandals involving Chester Arthur and James Garfield. The 1897 letter involves Burr's making a copy of a letter by Thomas Paine regarding Paine's service as an editor for the Pennsylvania Magazine.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: William Henry Burr was an atheist and newspaper reporter; one of his popular works was "Self-Contradictions of the Bible."
